title: Skull sceptre (i)

properties.name: description
properties.value: The skull sceptre (i) is an imbued version of the skull sceptre. Like the regular skull sceptre, the imbued sceptre can be used to teleport to Barbarian Village, and can autocast Crumble Undead as well as combat spells from the Arceuus spellbook. Note: Swapping weapons will turn off auto-cast settings.

Skull sceptre (i)

Item ID21276

The skull sceptre (i) is an imbued version of the skull sceptre. Like the regular skull sceptre, the imbued sceptre can be used to teleport to Barbarian Village, and can autocast Crumble Undead as well as combat spells from the Arceuus spellbook. Note: Swapping weapons will turn off auto-cast settings.

Unlike the regular skull sceptre, this sceptre does not break after depleting the teleport charges, and it can be recharged with bone fragments or sceptre pieces as explained below. As it is one of the few teleport items available to free-to-play, it is highly desired among those players.

It can be obtained by players who have set up the RuneScape Authenticator by showing a skull sceptre and a pair of fancy or fighting boots (equipped, in the bank, or in your inventory) to Solztun in the Stronghold of Security.

Warning: Should players disable the Authenticator, the sceptre will revert back to a regular skull sceptre when used on the next login after it is disabled. The chatbox message will read, "The Skull Sceptre suddenly loses its imbue due to the disabling of your authenticator."

Contents

  • 1 Combat styles

Combat styles[edit | edit source]

Staff
Combat OptionsCombat StyleStyle typeWeapon StyleExperienceInvisible Boost
BashCrushAccurateAttack and Hitpoints+3 Attack
PoundCrushAggressiveStrength and Hitpoints+3 Strength
FocusCrushDefensiveDefence and Hitpoints+3 Defence
SpellMagicDefensive AutocastMagic, Defence, and HitpointsNone
SpellMagicAutocastMagic and HitpointsNone

This sceptre can only be used to autocast combat spells from the Arceuus spellbook, or the Crumble Undead spell.

Teleport mechanics[edit | edit source]

The sceptre has two right-click options:

  • Invoke: The player will be teleported to the entrance of the Stronghold of Security in Barbarian Village. One charge will be consumed.
  • Divine: A dialogue box opens up that shows the number of remaining charges.

The sceptre can hold a maximum of 10 charges by default. Once the player has completed the easy, medium, hard and elite Varrock Diary, the sceptre can hold 14, 18, 22, and 26 charges respectively.

At any time, players can use bone fragments or sceptre pieces on the sceptre (which has to be in the inventory) to recharge it. Each fragment gives one charge. The amount of charges that a sceptre piece gives can be seen in the table below. It is the same as the amount of bone fragments that would be obtained by using a chisel on the sceptre piece.

Item Default Varrock Diary Completed
Easy Medium Hard Elite
Left skull half 5 6 7 8 9
Bottom of sceptre 3 4 5 6 7
Top of sceptre 3 4 5 6 7
Right skull half 3 4 5 6 7

Creation[edit | edit source]

Requirements
Talk to Solztun with fancy boots or fighting boots.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
30 June 2021
(update | poll)

The skull sceptre (i) can now autocast Crumble Undead.

16 June 2021
(update | poll)

The skull sceptre (i) can now autocast spells from the Arceuus spellbook.

28 April 2021
(update)

The sceptre's magic attack bonus has been increased from +4 to +10. It was changed from a polestaff to a staff, but no spells could be autocast with it yet.

18 November 2020
(update | poll)
  • Bone fragments can now be used to charge the sceptre.
  • The base number of charges you can hold on a completed Sceptre has been raised from 5 to 10.
  • Each completed tier of the Varrock Achievement Diary increases the number of max charges to 14, 18, 22, and 26 respectively.
  • Skull Sceptres are no longer destroyed they are dropped or killed and unprotected.
  • Multiple can be owned.
  • Multiple imbued Skull Sceptres share the same charges, but are only recharged with fragments, Sceptre pieces, or whole Skull Sceptres.
  • Unimbuing one imbued skull sceptre now unimbues them all, same rule for imbuing.
  • The "Destroy" option was replaced with a "Drop" option.
15 March 2018
(update)

The "Teleport" option while equipped was replaced with "Divine" and "Invoke" options.

[[File:Skull sceptre (i) detail.png|left|160px]]
The '''skull sceptre (i)''' is an imbued version of the [[skull sceptre]]. Like the regular skull sceptre, the imbued sceptre can be used to teleport to [[Barbarian Village]], and can autocast [[Crumble Undead]] as well as [[combat spells]] from the [[Arceuus spellbook]]. '''Note:''' Swapping weapons will turn off auto-cast settings.

Unlike the regular skull sceptre, this sceptre does not break after depleting the teleport charges, and it can be recharged with [[bone fragments]] or [[skull sceptre#Creating_the_Sceptre|sceptre pieces]] as explained [[#Teleport mechanics|below]]. As it is one of the few teleport items available to [[free-to-play]], it is highly desired among those players.

It can be obtained by players who have set up the [[RuneScape Authenticator]] by showing a [[skull sceptre]] and a pair of [[Fancy boots|fancy]] or [[fighting boots]] (equipped, in the bank, or in your inventory) to [[Solztun]] in the [[Stronghold of Security]].

'''Warning: '''''Should players disable the Authenticator, the sceptre '''will''' revert back to a regular [[skull sceptre]] when used on the next login after it is disabled. The chatbox message will read, "The Skull Sceptre suddenly loses its imbue due to the disabling of your authenticator."''

==Combat styles==
{{CombatStyles|Staff}}
This sceptre can only be used to autocast combat spells from the [[Arceuus spellbook]], or the [[Crumble Undead]] spell.

==Teleport mechanics==
The sceptre has two right-click options:
* Invoke: The player will be teleported to the entrance of the [[Stronghold of Security]] in [[Barbarian Village]]. One charge will be consumed.
* Divine: A dialogue box opens up that shows the number of remaining charges.

The sceptre can hold a maximum of 10 charges by default. Once the player has completed the easy, medium, hard and elite [[Varrock Diary]], the sceptre can hold 14, 18, 22, and 26 charges respectively.

At any time, players can use [[bone fragments]] or [[skull sceptre#Creating_the_Sceptre|sceptre pieces]] on the sceptre (which has to be in the inventory) to recharge it. Each fragment gives one charge. The amount of charges that a sceptre piece gives can be seen in the table below. It is the same as the amount of bone fragments that would be obtained by using a [[chisel]] on the sceptre piece.

{{Subject changes

|update = More Poll 73 Updates & Leagues Changes
|poll = Old School Content Poll 73: The :Joy: of Polls
|change = * Bone fragments can now be used to charge the sceptre.
* The base number of charges you can hold on a completed Sceptre has been raised from 5 to 10.
* Each completed tier of the Varrock Achievement Diary increases the number of max charges to 14, 18, 22, and 26 respectively.
* Skull Sceptres are no longer destroyed they are dropped or killed and unprotected. 
* Multiple can be owned.
* Multiple imbued Skull Sceptres share the same charges, but are only recharged with fragments, Sceptre pieces, or whole Skull Sceptres.
* Unimbuing one imbued skull sceptre now unimbues them all, same rule for imbuing.
* The "Destroy" option was replaced with a "Drop" option.
}}
{{Subject changes

}}
